title: God of War Ragnarok trailer teases Fenrir may be your wolf companion
description: God of War Ragnarok closed the latest PlayStation State of Play presentation with an action-loaded new trailer.

title: Sony's free rewards program PlayStation Stars launches this September
description: PlayStation Stars will launch in Asia later this year, before rolling out to other regions in the weeks after.

title: Kingston's new USB drive features a frankly unreal amount of military-grade security
description: The Kingston IronKey Keypad 200 promises users the highest levels of modern data protection.

title: ASUS wants you to use its new ExpertBook business laptop everywhere
description: Powered by the Qualcomm 7c Gen 2, the new B3 laptops houses a WUXGA resolution screen and Antibacterial Guard.

title: Steam accounts are being stolen by this devious phishing attack
description: Pro gamers targeted with "browser-in-browser" attacks, with stolen Steam accounts sold off on the black market.

title: Looking for a boot drive? Here's why you should go for an SSD, not an HDD
description: A new report on drive failure rate demonstrates why SSD boot drives are a better choice than HDD equivalents.

title: Meta is handing over its PyTorch AI platform to the Linux Foundation
description: Meta reveals PyTorch ownership is being transferred to the Linux Foundation.

title: You can remove Apple's newest iOS 16 security tool if you really want, but we wouldn't recommend it
description: iOS 16 Rapid Security Response can be disabled and enabled at any time, but it's probably not a good idea.

title: U-Haul confirms data breach, customer driving licences exposed
description: Hacker compromises two “unique passwords” and gains access to U-Haul search tool.

title: Discord is finally available to all Xbox Series X players
description: Discord voice chat has rolled out to all players on Xbox Series X|S after exiting the Insider Programme.

title: HP will pay you compensation if you bought the wrong printer ink
description: HP set to compensate customers impacted by issues surrounding “Dynamic Security”.

title: Intel accidentally leaks its own Raptor Lake CPUs
description: The specs of a trio of Raptor Lake processors have been mistakenly aired.

title: This new feature will make Microsoft Word feel even more like Google Docs
description: Create and assign tasks in Microsoft Word with new @mentions.

title: Breath of the Wild 2 finally has a release date – and a new name

title: Oracle is pushing some of its most popular database tools to AWS

title: IBM gives its Linux mainframe a major update
description: IBM’s latest z16-based Emperor 4 mainframe, designed specifically for Linux users, is about to drop.

title: Google Pixelbook is no more, proving the world wasn’t ready for premium Chromebooks
description: Google made one of the best laptops ever – but don’t expect any more Pixelbooks.

title: The Next World Forum provided insight into the future of eSports

title: New password manager does away with master passwords once and for all

title: iOS 16 finally brings two features to Photos that I've been asking for
